philosophy.core_logic: Balances aerobic development with moderate threshold work and targeted high-intensity sessions. The pyramidal distribution (most volume at low intensity, moderate at threshold, least at high intensity) mirrors the training patterns observed in many elite endurance athletes. Provides middle ground between polarized and threshold approaches, suitable for athletes who can tolerate some threshold work but want to maintain strong aerobic base.

assumptions.expectation: Consistent sleep ‚â•6.5 hours per night (7-day average)
assumptions.reasoning_justification: Pyramidal training includes moderate threshold work requiring adequate recovery. While less demanding than pure threshold training, still needs good sleep for lactate clearance and glycogen replenishment. 6.5+ hours provides minimum recovery capacity.

assumptions.expectation: No active injuries or pain requiring modification
assumptions.reasoning_justification: Pyramidal training includes both threshold and high-intensity work. Training through injury compromises form and risks chronic damage across multiple intensity zones.

assumptions.expectation: Base volume established for 6+ consecutive weeks
assumptions.reasoning_justification: Pyramidal training requires aerobic foundation to support threshold and high-intensity work. Six weeks ensures basic metabolic adaptations while being less restrictive than threshold methodology's 8-week requirement.

assumptions.expectation: Non-training stress rated as low or moderate
assumptions.reasoning_justification: Pyramidal training is more forgiving than pure threshold training. Can accommodate moderate life stress due to lower volume of sustained threshold work. High stress still contraindicated due to combined training load.

assumptions.expectation: Current volume between 6-20 hours per week
assumptions.reasoning_justification: Pyramidal training flexible across volume ranges. Below 6hrs, insufficient stimulus for adaptations. Above 20hrs, recovery demands high despite moderate intensity distribution.

assumptions.expectation: No recent illness in last 14 days
assumptions.reasoning_justification: Post-viral fatigue impairs both threshold and high-intensity performance. Pyramidal training includes both zones, requiring full recovery from illness.

exclusion_criteria.bridge_action: Seek evaluation and clearance from sports medicine professional. Return when injury_status == false and you have written clearance to resume training.
Establish consistent sleep routine targeting 7.0+ hours. Pyramidal training requires adequate recovery for threshold and HI work. Address sleep hygiene. Return when 7-day average ‚â• 6.5 hours.
Complete 6 weeks of consistent aerobic base building at current volume before introducing pyramidal training. Focus on Zone 1-2 work. Return when volume_consistency_weeks ‚â• 6.

Reduce life stress to moderate or consider polarized methodology. High stress + pyramidal training = elevated overtraining risk. Pyramidal includes more threshold work than polarized, requiring better stress management.
Allow 7-14 days post-symptom resolution before resuming pyramidal training. Start with easy aerobic only. Monitor resting HR. Return when recent_illness == false and resting HR within 5% of baseline.

exclusion_criteria.validation_logic: IF user.weekly_volume_hours < 6.0 OR user.weekly_volume_hours > 20.0 THEN REFUSE
exclusion_criteria.bridge_action: Adjust weekly volume to 6-20 hour range. If below 6hrs, build volume before pyramidal training. If above 20hrs, reduce to allow quality threshold/HI sessions. Volume and intensity inversely related.

failure_modes.condition: Difficulty recovering between threshold and high-intensity sessions
early_warning_signals: HRV declining 3+ consecutive days after intensity
Unable to hit target zones in threshold sessions
Elevated perceived exertion for same workouts
Sleep quality degradation after intensity days
failure_modes.mitigation_strategy: Increase recovery time between threshold and HI sessions to 72+ hours. Reduce threshold session frequency. Consider switching to polarized if persistent recovery issues.

failure_modes.condition: Life stress increases during training block
early_warning_signals: Stress level shifts from low to moderate
failure_modes.mitigation_strategy: Reduce threshold volume by 30%. Maintain HI sessions at low frequency (1x/week). Focus on quality over quantity. If stress remains elevated, switch to polarized methodology.

failure_modes.condition: Accumulating fatigue from insufficient easy volume
early_warning_signals: Consistent inability to recover between sessions
Morning HRV below baseline for 5+ days
Intensity sessions feel harder than usual
Increased injury risk signals (persistent soreness, stiffness)
failure_modes.mitigation_strategy: Increase easy aerobic volume percentage to 80-82%. Reduce threshold work to 12-13%. Insert recovery week with 40% volume reduction. Ensure 77/15/8 distribution maintained.
